page.title: 07CUSTOMS IN BRAMSHAW AREA
page.content: {FOREST RIGHTS }Several houses retain traditional Forest Rights of pasture mast &(less often) fuel. For some commoners with smallholdings, the ability to turn stock out on forest is vital economic factor. Others exercise their rights to keep tradition alive & to enjoy country interests. { {BRANDING & MARKING.}All stock turned out must carry an identifying brand. Until 1986 agisters branded with a hot iron but henceforth cattle will be freeze branded. Each agister also cuts the animals' tails in a distinctive fashion so that should it wander afield its "home" agister can be identified. A marking fee is paid to the verderers for each animal depastured. {CATTLE & PONY DRIFTS}- See Events.{ {HUNTING }See page 8
